p: Tables 2, 3. showed that the highest percentage of oxygenated monoterpenes was observed in the essential oil of T. articulata (82.70%) followed by C. decurrens (33.77%) and C. sempervirens (7.38%). Camphor (21.23%) was the major oxygenated monoterpene in essential oil of T. articulata followed by bornyl acetate (15.03%), while α-fenchyl acetate (14.16%) and α-fenchol (13.07%) were the major oxygenated monoterpenes in the essential oil of C. decurrens. Whereas, thymol (4.25%) and borneol (2.33%) were the major oxygenated monoterpenes detected in the essential oil of C. sempervirens.
